intro: Croton gonaivensis, commonly known as the Haitian croton, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Haiti. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and vibrant, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens.
